review:
Let’s cut through the noise: eth.limo is not just another gateway. It’s a bulwark against the creeping centralization of the web, a public good standing tall for the Ethereum community. The project’s impact is undeniable—over 1 billion requests per year, default resolver for app.ens.domains, and a lifeline for dApps, DAOs, and independent creators alike. This is infrastructure that the people actually use, not some vaporware promising the moon.

The team’s commitment to privacy is ironclad. No IP logging, no TCP fingerprinting, and active resistance to surveillance tech like Google’s FLoC. That’s not just technical innovation—it’s a political stance for user rights and digital dignity. The roadmap is ambitious but grounded: multi-region CDN, native DNS resolver, and Gateway as a Service. These aren’t empty buzzwords; they’re concrete steps to make the decentralized web accessible, resilient, and truly public.

But let’s not get swept away by rhetoric alone. The application is strong, but it’s not perfect. There’s a lack of detailed, transparent reporting on past grant outcomes. Where are the hard numbers on uptime, latency improvements, or user growth post-funding? The roadmap, while comprehensive, could use more specificity—timelines, milestones, and measurable KPIs. And while the project claims to operate as a public good, there’s little detail on community governance or how users can participate in decision-making beyond vague commitments.

In the spirit of equity and collective benefit, we must demand more than good intentions. We need rigorous, transparent measurement and a clear path to sustainable, community-led stewardship. Only then can we ensure that eth.limo remains a beacon for the commons, not just another centralized chokepoint in disguise.

strengths.title: Massive, Measurable Impact
strengths.description: Handles over 1 billion requests per year, serving as the default resolver for major ENS projects and supporting a wide range of users from DAOs to independent creators.

strengths.title: Strong Privacy and Security Ethos
strengths.description: Implements strict privacy protections (no IP logging, no TCP fingerprinting, FLoC blocking) and positions itself as a defender of user rights in the face of increasing surveillance.

strengths.title: Open Source and Public Good Orientation
strengths.description: Commits to open source principles, operates as a public good, and provides critical infrastructure for the Ethereum ecosystem.

strengths.title: Ambitious, Relevant Roadmap
strengths.description: Plans for multi-region CDN, native DNS resolver, and Gateway as a Service directly address scalability, reliability, and accessibility challenges in the decentralized web.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Transparent Outcome Reporting
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide detailed, quantifiable reporting on the impact of previous grants or specific metrics on improvements achieved with past funding.

weaknesses.title: Insufficient Detail on Community Governance
weaknesses.description: While the project claims to be community-oriented, there is little concrete information on governance structures, decision-making processes, or mechanisms for user participation.

weaknesses.title: Roadmap Lacks Specific Milestones and KPIs
weaknesses.description: The roadmap is ambitious but vague; it lacks clear timelines, measurable milestones, and key performance indicators to track progress and ensure accountability.

changes.title: Provide Detailed Impact Reports
changes.description: Submit transparent, data-driven reports on the outcomes of previous grants, including metrics such as uptime, latency, user growth, and specific improvements achieved.

changes.title: Clarify Community Governance Model
changes.description: Detail the governance structure, including how community members can participate in decision-making, oversight mechanisms, and plans for ensuring equitable representation.

changes.title: Define Roadmap Milestones and KPIs
changes.description: Break down the roadmap into specific, time-bound milestones with measurable KPIs to enable rigorous evaluation and transparent progress tracking.
